contents.label: section-title
contents.text: FBI’s Use of Face Recognition Technology

contents.label: section-title
contents.text: Privacy Laws and Responsibilities at DOJ

contents.label: section-title
contents.text: DOJ and FBI Have Taken Steps Since May 2016 to Better Ensure Privacy but Work Remains to Fully Address Prior Recommendations

contents.label: section-title
contents.text: DOJ Has Taken Steps to More Quickly Publish Privacy Impact Assessments but Has Not Fully Implemented Its Revised Process

contents.label: section-title
contents.text: DOJ Did Not Complete a SORN Addressing FBI’s Face Recognition Capabilities in a Timely Manner and Has Not Implemented Corrective Actions

contents.label: section-title
contents.text: FBI Has Taken Limited Actions to Address Our Recommendations for Ensuring the Accuracy of Its Face Recognition Capabilities

contents.label: section-title
contents.text: FBI Has Conducted Limited Assessments of the Accuracy of NGI-IPS Face Recognition Searches

contents.label: section-title
contents.text: FBI Agreed to Conduct Annual Operational Reviews of NGI-IPS but Implementation Is Incomplete

contents.label: section-title
contents.text: FBI Has Not Assessed the Accuracy of External Partners’ Face Recognition Systems Used by FACE Services
